1:
--------------------
Text: Waterzooi:  The second part of the name derives from the Middle Dutch terms "sode", "zo(o)de" and "soot", words referring to the act of boiling or the ingredients being boiled.

<Waterzooi
2:
--------------------
Text: Waterzooi:  It is sometimes called "Gentse Waterzooi" which refers to the Belgian town of Ghent where it originated.
Triplets:<Waterzooi
3:
--------------------
Text: Waterzooi:  The original dish is often made of fish, either freshwater or sea, (known as "Viszooitje"), though today chicken waterzooi ("Kippenwaterzooi") is more common.

Triplets:<Waterzooi
